ground_truth: The fellas crack up, and they all mutter equivalents as Joe stands up. Mr. Blonde shoots Mr. White with his finger, and everybody whips out a buck, throwing it on the table, except Mr. Pink. Everybody laughs, and they all laugh repeatedly while Mr. Pink rubs two of his fingers together. Joe comes back to the table as Mr. Orange screams, lying in the backseat, having been shot in the stomach with blood covering him and the backseat. Mr. White, behind the wheel of the getaway car, although driving for his life, keeps talking to his wounded passenger in the backseat, and they are the only two in the car. The door swings open, and Mr. White carries the bloody body of Mr. Orange inside, who is still moaning loudly from his bullet hit. Mr. White lays him down upon a mattress on the floor, and Mr. Orange looks up at his friend. Mr. White then gets Mr. Orange in a headlock as Mr. Blonde sits on a counter, drinking a fast food coke and eating a hot dog. Mr. Pink sees Mr. Orange on the floor, shot and bloody, and Mr. Orange lays his head back on the mattress. The two men end up on the floor kicking and scratching as the camera creeps along a wall to a corner where a bathroom lies at the end of the hall. Mr. Pink is obscured, but Mr. White is in view, and he turns to leave. Guns are firing, people shouting and screaming, sirens wailing as Mr. Pink tries to open the driver's side door, but it's locked. The shocked woman starts screaming, and Mr. Pink exits the frame, leaving Mr. White alone. The men share a laugh as we follow behind him up to Mr. White, standing over Mr. Orange, and as he gets closer, he sees Mr. Orange is out. Mr. White stands up, walks over to a table, and Mr. Pink reaches in his jacket for his gun, pulling it out. Mr. White sees this, immediately lets go of Mr. Pink, and goes for his weapon, resulting in the two men with their guns outstretched, aiming at one another. Mr. Blonde looks at his two partners in crime as Mr. White explodes, raising his gun and charging towards Mr. Blonde, but Mr. White calms down and puts his gun away. Mr. Blonde stops moving, heads for the door while the other two men just follow him with their eyes, and then walks out, heading towards the car he drove, with Mr. White and Mr. Pink walking behind. In the background, what looks like an office is set up.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The guys crack up, and they all murmur equivalents as Joe rises up. Mr. Blonde fires at Mr. White with his finger, and everyone pulls out a dollar, tossing it on the table, except Mr. Pink. Everyone chuckles, and they all laugh repeatedly while Mr. Pink rubs two of his fingers together. Joe returns to the table as Mr. Orange yells, lying in the backseat, having been hit in the abdomen with blood covering him and the backseat. Mr. White, behind the controls of the getaway car, although driving for his life, keeps speaking to his injured passenger in the backseat, and they are the only two in the car. The door swings open, and Mr. White carries the bleeding body of Mr. Orange inside, who is still groaning loudly from his bullet wound. Mr. White places him down upon a mattress on the floor, and Mr. Orange looks up at his companion. Mr. White then gets Mr. Orange in a headlock as Mr. Blonde perches on a counter, drinking a fast food cola and eating a hot dog. Mr. Pink notices Mr. Orange on the floor, shot and bleeding, and Mr. Orange rests his head back on the mattress. The two men end up on the floor kicking and clawing as the camera creeps along a wall to a corner where a restroom lies at the end of the hall. Mr. Pink is obscured, but Mr. White is in view, and he turns to leave. Guns are discharging, people shouting and shrieking, sirens wailing as Mr. Pink tries to open the driver's side door, but it's locked. The stunned woman starts shrieking, and Mr. Pink exits the frame, leaving Mr. White alone. The men share a chuckle as we follow behind him up to Mr. White, standing over Mr. Orange, and as he gets closer, he sees Mr. Orange is out. Mr. White stands up, walks over to a table, and Mr. Pink reaches in his jacket for his firearm, pulling it out. Mr. White sees this, immediately releases Mr. Pink, and goes for his weapon, resulting in the two men with their guns outstretched, aiming at one another. Mr. Blonde gazes at his two accomplices as Mr. White erupts, raising his gun and rushing towards Mr. Blonde, but Mr. White calms down and puts his gun away. Mr. Blonde halts movement, heads for the door while the other two men just follow him with their eyes, and then walks out, heading towards the car he drove, with Mr. White and Mr. Pink walking behind. In the background, what appears like an office is set up.

Mr. White, who is behind the wheel of the getaway car, although driving for his life, keeps talking to his wounded passenger in the backseat, and they are the only two in the car. Mr. Orange on the floor is seen by Mr. Pink, shot and bloody, and Mr. Orange lays his head back on the mattress. The two men end up on the floor kicking and scratching as the camera creeps along a wall to a corner where a bathroom lies at the end of the hall. The shocked woman starts screaming, and Mr. Pink exits the frame, leaving Mr. White alone. A laugh is shared by the men as we follow behind him up to Mr. White, standing over Mr. Orange, and as he gets closer, Mr. Orange is seen to be out. Mr. White stands up, walks over to a table, and his gun is reached for by Mr. Pink, pulling it out of his jacket. This is seen by Mr. White, who immediately lets go of Mr. Pink, and he goes for his weapon, resulting in the two men with their guns outstretched, aiming at one another. Mr. Blonde looks at his two partners in crime as Mr. White explodes, raising his gun and charging towards Mr. Blonde, but then he calms down and puts his gun away. Mr. Blonde stops moving, heads for the door while the other two men just follow him with their eyes, and then he walks out, heading towards the car he drove, with Mr. White and Mr. Pink walking behind. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The fellas crack up as Joe stands. Mr. Blonde pretends to shoot Mr. White; everyone throws a buck on the table except Mr. Pink, who rubs his fingers together. Joe returns while Mr. Orange screams from the backseat, bleeding after being shot in the stomach. Mr. White drives the getaway car, talking to the wounded Mr. Orange. Mr. White opens the door and carries Mr. Orange inside, laying him on a mattress. Mr. Blonde sits, drinking coke and eating a hot dog. Mr. Pink sees the bloody Mr. Orange, who lays back. The men end up kicking and scratching, as the camera moves to a bathroom. Mr. Pink is hidden but Mr. White turns to leave amidst gunfire, shouts, screams, and sirens. Mr. Pink tries to open the locked car door and exits, leaving Mr. White alone. They laugh as Mr. White checks on Mr. Orange, who is unconscious. Mr. White walks to a table; Mr. Pink pulls out a gun. Seeing this, Mr. White lets go of Mr. Pink and draws his weapon. Mr. Blonde watches as Mr. White charges him, but calms and holsters his gun. Mr. Blonde exits, heading for the car, followed by Mr. White and Mr. Pink. An office can be seen in the background.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The guys laugh as Joe stands. Mr. Blonde mimics shooting Mr. White, and everyone throws a dollar on the table except Mr. Pink, who rubs his fingers together. Joe returns as Mr. Orange screams, shot in the abdomen, bleeding in the backseat. Mr. White, driving the getaway car, talks to the injured Mr. Orange, the only passenger. The door opens, and Mr. White carries Mr. Orange inside, laying him on a mattress. Mr. White puts Mr. Orange in a headlock while Mr. Blonde drinks a coke and eats a hot dog. Mr. Pink sees Mr. Orange, shot and bloody, as Mr. Orange rests his head. Two men fight on the floor as the camera pans to a bathroom. Mr. White is visible while Mr. Pink is not, leaving Mr. White alone amid gunfire, shouting, and sirens. Mr. Pink exits, and the men laugh as Mr. White stands over Mr. Orange, now unconscious. Mr. Pink pulls out his gun, and Mr. White mirrors the action. Mr. Blonde watches as Mr. White calms down and holsters his gun. Mr. Blonde leaves for the car with Mr. White and Mr. Pink following. An office setup is visible in the background.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The group of fellows erupts into shared laughter, and they all mutter similar words as if in a chorus of agreement, while Joe stands up from his seat. With a playful motion, Mr. Blonde mimics shooting Mr. White using just his finger as if it were a gun, capturing the light-hearted banter of the moment. In response, everyone at the table swiftly pulls out a dollar bill, tossing their contributions onto the table surface with the exception of Mr. Pink. The room echoes with their amusement as they continue to laugh repeatedly, with Mr. Pink joining in the fun by rubbing two of his fingers together in a gesture understood among the group. Meanwhile, Joe returns to the table amidst the commotion, and the scene sharply shifts to Mr. Orange, who is screaming in agony while lying in the backseat of a car. His stomach has been grievously wounded by a gunshot, and both he and the car's backseat are drenched in blood. At the wheel of the getaway vehicle, Mr. White drives with an urgency that betrays the life-and-death situation they are in, yet he continuously speaks to his injured passenger in the backseat, with the two of them being the only occupants of the car. 

As the car abruptly comes to a stop, the door swings open with force, and Mr. White hurriedly carries the severely bleeding body of Mr. Orange inside a building. Mr. Orange, still moaning loudly from the pain of his bullet wound, is tenderly laid down by Mr. White onto a mattress positioned on the floor. As Mr. Orange gazes up at his companion, Mr. White comforts him by pulling him into a headlock, offering a moment of connection amid the chaos. Watching this unfold, Mr. Blonde casually sits atop a nearby counter, sipping on a fast food coke and munching on a hot dog, seemingly unfazed by the tension around him. As Mr. Pink enters the scene, he observes Mr. Orange, wounded and covered in blood on the floor. Mr. Orange, exhausted, rests his head back against the mattress.

Amidst the chaos, a struggle ensues, with the two men ending up on the floor, engaged in a frantic exchange of kicks and scratches. The camera stealthily moves along the wall, capturing the scene, until it reaches a corner where a bathroom is visible at the end of the hallway. Though Mr. Pink is obscured from view, Mr. White remains in sight, and soon he turns to exit the scene. In the midst of this tense situation, the soundscape is filled with guns firing, people shouting, and sirens wailing. Mr. Pink attempts to open the driver’s side door of a vehicle, only to find it locked. A woman, caught in shock, begins to scream, and Mr. Pink subsequently exits the scene, leaving Mr. White standing alone.

As events unfold, the men share a moment of laughter, and the camera follows them to focus on Mr. White who stands over Mr. Orange. As he approaches closer, he notices that Mr. Orange has passed out. Rising to his feet, Mr. White strides over to a table, while Mr. Pink reaches inside his jacket to retrieve his gun, pulling it out with deliberate intent. Observing this, Mr. White quickly releases his hold on Mr. Pink and reaches for his own weapon, leading to a tense standoff with both men aiming their guns at each other. Mr. Blonde, observing his two partners in crime with an inscrutable look, watches as Mr. White suddenly erupts with emotion, raising his gun and charging towards Mr. Blonde. However, Mr. White swiftly calms himself, opting to put his gun away instead.

In response, Mr. Blonde ceases his movement and calmly heads for the door, while the other two men track his movement with their eyes. Mr. Blonde then departs from the room, walking towards the car he drove, with both Mr. White and Mr. Pink following him closely behind. In the background, the setting resembles an office setup, adding an air of normalcy to the otherwise chaotic scene.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The tightly-knit group of fellows erupts into a wave of shared laughter, and they all mutter similar words, sounding as if they are in a harmonious chorus of agreement. As this lively interaction unfolds, Joe rises up with purpose from his seat. With a playful and animated motion, Mr. Blonde starts mimicking the action of shooting Mr. White, using just his finger as if it were a gun, capturing the essence of the light-hearted banter of the moment. In response to this amusing display, everyone seated at the table swiftly pulls out a dollar bill, tossing their monetary contributions onto the surface of the table, with the notable exception of Mr. Pink. The room reverberates with their amusement as they continue to laugh repeatedly, and Mr. Pink joins in the fun by rubbing two of his fingers together in a gesture that holds a shared understanding among the group. Meanwhile, amidst the commotion and collective laughter, Joe returns to the table, and at this moment, the scene sharply shifts to focus on Mr. Orange. He is depicted screaming in agony while lying in the backseat of a car, his stomach grievously wounded by a gunshot. Both he and the backseat of the car are drenched in blood. At the wheel of the getaway vehicle, Mr. White drives with an urgency that betrays the life-and-death situation in which they find themselves, yet he continuously speaks to his injured passenger in the backseat, with the two of them being the sole occupants of the car. 

As the car comes to an abrupt stop, the door swings open with force, and Mr. White hurriedly carries the severely bleeding body of Mr. Orange inside a nearby building. Mr. Orange, still moaning loudly from the excruciating pain of his bullet wound, is tenderly laid down by Mr. White onto a mattress that has been positioned on the floor. As Mr. Orange gazes upwards at his companion, Mr. White offers him comfort by pulling him into a headlock, offering a brief moment of human connection amid the surrounding chaos. Observing this unfold, Mr. Blonde sits casually atop a nearby counter, sipping on a fast-food coke and munching on a hot dog, seemingly unfazed by the tension and urgency around him. As Mr. Pink enters the scene, he takes note of Mr. Orange, who is wounded and covered in blood on the floor beneath him. Mr. Orange, clearly exhausted, lets his head gently rest back against the mattress.

Amidst the turmoil, a chaotic struggle ensues, with the two men ending up engaged in a frantic exchange of kicks and scratches on the floor. The camera stealthily moves along the wall, capturing the scene, until it reaches a corner where a bathroom is visible at the end of the long hallway. Though Mr. Pink is obscured from view, Mr. White remains in sight, and soon he turns to exit the unfolding scene. In the midst of this tense and dramatic situation, the soundscape is filled with the harsh sounds of guns firing, people shouting, and sirens wailing. Mr. Pink tries to open the driver’s side door of a vehicle, only to find it disappointingly locked. A woman, caught in shock and surprise, begins to scream, and Mr. Pink subsequently exits the scene, leaving Mr. White standing alone.

As events unfold further, the group of men share a fleeting moment of laughter, and the camera follows them to focus on Mr. White, who stands over Mr. Orange. As Mr. White approaches closer to him, he notices that Mr. Orange has passed out. Rising to his feet, Mr. White strides over to a table, while Mr. Pink reaches inside his jacket to retrieve his gun, pulling it out with deliberate and measured intent. Observing this action, Mr. White quickly releases his hold on Mr. Pink and reaches for his own weapon, leading to a tense and dramatic standoff, with both men aiming their guns pointedly at each other. Mr. Blonde, observing his two partners in crime with an inscrutable expression, watches closely as Mr. White suddenly erupts with emotion, raising his gun and charging with intensity towards Mr. Blonde. However, Mr. White swiftly calms himself, opting to put his gun away instead.

In response to this de-escalation, Mr. Blonde ceases his movement and calmly heads for the door, while the other two men track his movement with their eyes, following him closely. Mr. Blonde then departs from the room, walking purposefully towards the car he drove, with both Mr. White and Mr. Pink trailing closely behind him. In the background, the setting resembles an ordinary office setup, adding an unexpected air of normalcy to the otherwise chaotic and dramatic scene.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the group of men erupts into laughter, each of them begins to mumble similar phrases while Joe rises from his seat. In a playful gesture, Mr. Blonde extends his hand and pretends to shoot Mr. White with his finger, prompting everyone except Mr. Pink to pull out a dollar bill and toss it onto the table, adding to the collective amusement. Amidst the ongoing laughter, Mr. Pink makes a subtle gesture by rubbing two of his fingers together. Meanwhile, Joe reappears at the table just as Mr. Orange lets out a scream from the backseat, writhing in pain, having been shot in the stomach, causing blood to spread over him and the seat. As Mr. White remains at the wheel of the vehicle meant for their escape, he clings to his focus on driving despite the gravity of their situation, engaging in conversation with his injured companion, Mr. Orange, who shares the car with him. The car door swings open as Mr. White carefully lifts the bloodied and groaning Mr. Orange from the vehicle, carrying him inside, where he gently lays him down on a mattress lying on the floor. Mr. Orange directs his gaze upwards towards his friend. In a surprising move, Mr. White then pulls Mr. Orange into a headlock while Mr. Blonde casually sits on a counter, sipping on a fast food soda and munching on a hot dog. The sight of Mr. Orange, shot and bleeding on the floor, catches the attention of Mr. Pink. Mr. Orange then tilts his head back onto the mattress. The situation intensifies as the two men lose control and engage in a fierce struggle on the floor, kicking and scratching at each other, while the camera slowly pans along the wall, revealing a hallway that ends at a bathroom. Although the view of Mr. Pink is partially blocked, Mr. White remains in sight as he decides to turn away and leave. Chaos ensues with the sound of gunfire, shouts, screams, and the wailing of sirens, as Mr. Pink frantically attempts to open the driver's side door, only to find it locked. A startled woman begins to scream, prompting Mr. Pink to exit the scene, leaving Mr. White by himself. Amidst the tension, the men share a moment of laughter, and the focus shifts as we trail behind to Mr. White, who is standing over Mr. Orange. Upon approaching closer, it becomes apparent that Mr. Orange has passed out. Mr. White gets to his feet and moves toward a table, while Mr. Pink, reacting swiftly, reaches inside his jacket to retrieve his gun. Observing this, Mr. White promptly releases Mr. Pink and reaches for his own weapon, leading to a standoff where both men extend their guns, aiming at each other. Mr. Blonde watches his two accomplices, and as Mr. White's emotions flare, he raises his gun and charges at Mr. Blonde, only to regain his composure and lower his firearm. Mr. Blonde remains stationary, decides to head for the door, and exits, making his way towards the vehicle he had driven, with Mr. White and Mr. Pink watching him leave, trailing him with their eyes. In the background, there is the appearance of an office environment set up.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The group bursts into laughter with everyone tossing a dollar on the table except Mr. Pink, who gestures his reluctance. Amidst the chaos, Joe returns as Mr. Orange screams in pain, bleeding from a stomach wound in the backseat, while Mr. White urgently drives the getaway car, comforting him. Once they arrive, Mr. White carries Mr. Orange inside, laying him on a mattress. Despite Mr. Orange's agony, Mr. White holds him in a supportive headlock as Mr. Blonde casually eats nearby. Mr. Pink notices the wounded Mr. Orange and joins the tense scene. As the situation escalates, they all end up in a fracas, with Mr. White leaving and Mr. Pink struggling with the locked car door amid gunfire and chaos. Eventually, Mr. White stands over an unconscious Mr. Orange, while Mr. Pink draws his gun, prompting Mr. White to do the same. A tense standoff ensues, calmed as Mr. White holsters his gun. Mr. Blonde then exits, leaving Mr. White and Mr. Pink to follow him with their gaze as he heads towards the car, passing what appears to be an office setup in the background.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The fellas crack up, and they all mutter equivalents as Joe, who is known for his laid-back leadership in the criminal underworld, stands up. Mr. Blonde, who is notorious for his volatile nature, shoots Mr. White with his finger as if playing a child’s game, and everybody whips out a buck, throwing it on the table, except Mr. Pink, who is infamous for his tightfistedness. Everybody laughs, a tension-relieving sound in their line of work, and they all laugh repeatedly while Mr. Pink rubs two of his fingers together, symbolizing money. Joe comes back to the table as Mr. Orange screams, lying in the backseat, having been shot in the stomach with blood covering him and the backseat of the stolen car after a heist gone wrong. Mr. White, a seasoned getaway driver, although driving for his life, keeps talking to his wounded passenger in the backseat, and they are the only two in the car, which speeds through dimly lit streets. The door swings open, and Mr. White carries the bloody body of Mr. Orange inside, who is still moaning loudly from his bullet hit, echoing through the abandoned warehouse they chose as a hideout. Mr. White lays him down upon a mattress on the floor, and Mr. Orange looks up at his friend, eyes filled with trust and pain. Mr. White then gets Mr. Orange in a headlock, trying to control the situation, as Mr. Blonde sits on a counter, drinking a fast food coke and eating a hot dog, seemingly indifferent to the chaos around him. Mr. Pink sees Mr. Orange on the floor, shot and bloody, and Mr. Orange lays his head back on the mattress, surrendering to exhaustion. The two men, Mr. White and Mr. Pink, end up on the floor kicking and scratching as the camera creeps along a wall to a corner where a bathroom lies at the end of the hall, its broken door hinting at past violence. Mr. Pink is obscured, but Mr. White is in view, and he turns to leave, determination etched on his face. Guns are firing, people shouting and screaming, sirens wailing from a recent police raid as Mr. Pink tries to open the driver's side door, but it's locked. The shocked woman nearby starts screaming, a desperate sound in the chaotic scene, and Mr. Pink exits the frame, leaving Mr. White alone in a moment of uncertainty. The men share a laugh, a brief respite from their predicament, as we follow behind him up to Mr. White, standing over Mr. Orange, and as he gets closer, he sees Mr. Orange is out, unconscious or perhaps worse. Mr. White stands up, walks over to a table scattered with maps and stolen goods from the botched robbery, and Mr. Pink reaches in his jacket for his gun, pulling it out as tensions rise again. Mr. White sees this, immediately lets go of Mr. Pink, and goes for his weapon, resulting in the two men with their guns outstretched, aiming at one another in a standoff reminiscent of countless crime films. Mr. Blonde looks at his two partners in crime, aware of the fragile alliance, as Mr. White explodes briefly, raising his gun and charging towards Mr. Blonde, but Mr. White calms down and puts his gun away, the tension ebbing temporarily. Mr. Blonde stops moving, heads for the door while the other two men just follow him with their eyes, distrust still lingering in the air, and then walks out, heading towards the car he drove, a stolen sedan, with Mr. White and Mr. Pink walking behind, their footsteps echoing in the empty street. In the background, what looks like an office is set up, suggesting a sophisticated if disorganized operational base behind their criminal activities.

The two men end up on the floor kicking and scratching as the camera creeps along a wall to a corner where a bathroom lies at the end of the hall. Mr Pink is obscured but Mr White is in view and he turns to leave. Guns are firing people shouting and screaming sirens wailing as Mr Pink tries to open the driver's side door but it is locked. The shocked woman starts screaming and Mr Pink exits the frame leaving Mr White alone. The men share a laugh as we follow behind him up to Mr White standing over Mr Orange and as he gets closer he sees Mr Orange is out. Mr White stands up walks over to a table and Mr Pink reaches in his jacket for his gun pulling it out. Mr White sees this immediately let us go of Mr Pink and goes for his weapon resulting in the two men with their guns outstretched aiming at one another. Mr Blonde looks at his two partners in crime as Mr White explodes raising his gun and charging towards Mr Blonde but Mr White calms down and puts his gun away. Mr Blonde stops moving heads for the door while the other two men just follow him with their eyes and then walks out heading towards the car he drove with Mr White and Mr Pink walking behind. In the background what looks like an office is set up.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The crows giggle, and they all whisper nonsense as Bob floats down. Dr. Stripe zaps Dr. Brown with his toe, and everyone pulls out a coin, tossing it on the sand, except Dr. Green. Everyone giggles, and they all giggle again while Dr. Green snaps two of his toes together. Bob returns to the sand as Dr. Blue sings, lounging in the trunk, having been tickled in the elbow with paint covering him and the trunk. Dr. Brown, beneath the steering wheel of the escape boat, although sailing for his lunch, keeps singing to his laughing companion in the trunk, and they are the only parrots in the boat. The hatch swings shut, and Dr. Brown ferries the painted figure of Dr. Blue outside, who is still laughing loudly from his feather poke. Dr. Brown places him down upon a pillow on the grass, and Dr. Blue gazes up at his pal. Dr. Brown then places Dr. Blue in a dance move as Dr. Stripe lounges on a bench, sipping a fresh lemonade and munching a pretzel. Dr. Green spots Dr. Blue on the grass, laughing and painted, and Dr. Blue rests his hat on the pillow. The two parrots end up on the carpet dancing and leaping as the lens sneaks along a fence to a corner where a pantry sits at the edge of the lane. Dr. Green is hidden, but Dr. Brown is visible, and he turns to float away. Fireworks are sparking, creatures whispering and singing, alarms wailing as Dr. Green tries to peek the captain's side hatch, but it's closed. The amazed cat starts whispering, and Dr. Green exits the scene, leaving Dr. Brown alone. The parrots share a chuckle as we drift behind him up to Dr. Brown, floating above Dr. Blue, and as he gets nearer, he sees Dr. Blue is sleeping. Dr. Brown floats up, drifts over to a bench, and Dr. Green searches in his vest for his blaster, pulling it out. Dr. Brown notices this, instantly releases Dr. Green, and reaches for his dagger, resulting in the two parrots with their blasters extended, gesturing at one another. Dr. Stripe glances at his two comrades in mischief as Dr. Brown pops, lifting his blaster and sprinting towards Dr. Stripe, but Dr. Brown settles down and sheathes his blaster. Dr. Stripe ceases drifting, strolls for the hatch while the other two parrots just trail him with their beaks, and then strolls out, jogging towards the boat he sailed, with Dr. Brown and Dr. Green drifting behind. In the background, what resembles a laboratory is set up.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The group laughs together as Mr. Blonde playfully mimics shooting Mr. White. Meanwhile, Mr. Orange, shot in the stomach, is bleeding in the backseat while Mr. White drives them to safety. Mr. White carries Mr. Orange inside and lays him on a mattress. Tensions rise as Mr. Blonde casually drinks a soda and eats a hot dog while Mr. Pink notices Mr. Orange's condition. A scuffle ensues, with gunfire and chaos erupting as Mr. Pink struggles to open a locked car door. Eventually, Mr. White and Mr. Pink draw guns on each other, but Mr. Blonde heads for the door, prompting Mr. White to calm down. Mr. Blonde exits, and the scene shifts to an office-like setting as Mr. White and Mr. Pink follow.
